critique: The document outlines regulations governing the exportation of articles and materials designated in Proclamation No. 2465 of March 4, 1941, issued pursuant to section 6 of the act of Congress approved July 2, 1940, entitled "An Act to expedite the strengthening of the national defense". It establishes the role of the Administrator of Export Control, the process for obtaining export licenses, and the conditions under which licenses may be issued, revoked, or altered. The regulations aim to control the flow of materials deemed important for national defense during a period of international tension.
